meanings.definition: A portion of territory surrounded by a larger territory whose inhabitants are culturally or ethnically distinct.
meanings.sent1: The small enclave of artists in the city created beautiful murals on the walls.
meanings.sent2: The Chinatown enclave in the bustling city offered delicious authentic cuisine.
meanings.sent3: The enclave of penguins decided to throw a fancy ball on the iceberg.
meanings.sent4: In the vast forest, the enclave of fireflies lit up the night like tiny lanterns.
meanings.sent5: The enclave of musicians filled the air with harmonious melodies.

meanings.definition: A group or set of people that is different in some way from the larger group they are a part of.
meanings.sent1: The book club formed a cozy enclave within the school community.
meanings.sent2: The enclave of tech enthusiasts always had the latest gadgets.
meanings.sent3: The enclave of cats in the neighborhood held secret meetings under the moonlight.
meanings.sent4: Her laughter stood out in the enclave of serious faces during the meeting.
meanings.sent5: The enclave of fashionistas turned heads with their unique sense of style.
